item.description:
I've been toying with the idea of covering the entire Skyline in a day - 18 miles down and back. While the short days makes it tough this time of year, we can always enjoy exploring different sections of the trail.

This Sunday I would like to explore the center and eastern sections of the main skyline trail. We can start at Houghton's Pond and travel east for about an hour and a half. We would then return on less traveled side trails and cross paths.

I'm thinking about a 3 hour hike, starting at 10am, with the option to add an hour if the group desires.

Please wear layers and be prepared for cold wind. Please bring enough water and snacks for you and you pet. If you have to leave early I can always point you in the right direction but it would be wise bring a map.


This is not a walk on paved paths. I like the ups and downs, and try to venture on more challenging terrain. Please wear sturdy footwear, as the leaves over rocks makes things slippery.

If you have any questions please feel free to send me a message.
item.name: Blue Hills Skyline Traverse
